result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Lambrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Loud, Boisterous and Profane Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs are paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The remaining portion of the cash bond has been refunded to the poster.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to have no further argumentative or confrontational contact with the victim as named in the Complaint, K. Lambrecht.
Defendant is to complete an Anger Management Program as prescribed by the Supervising Agent.    DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Disorderly Conduct - Loud, Boisterous and Profane Conduct
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Lambrecht

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 9:57 PM: Defendant Michael J. Lambrecht in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Matter was contemplated for JT with a Court Appointed Counsel.  Prior to going of record, Def confirmed he wanted to go forward today without counsel and matter was resolved.  State will move for amendment of Count 2 and also withdrawal of Motion to Amend Complaint.  Defendant confirms State's recital.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts State's Motion to Amend Ct 2 to loud, boisterous and profane conduct which caused a disturbance with abusive conduct reference deleted - Plea Ct 2 DC:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Dom Abuse Enh dismissed and Ct 1 DRI.  Argument by DA.   Argument by Def - none offered.  The Court:   60 days WCJ -  I/S - Huber and GT - No TS credit.  S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; no argumentative or confrontational contact with K. Lambrecht; Complete an Anger Mgmt Program as prescribed by Supervising Agent; Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 09:55 am.

10:59 am case called. Defendant Michael J. Lambrecht in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he is not accepting the officer of the district attorney. Defendant wished to proceed without counsel. Court questions defendant regarding status. Defendant requests Jury Trial to be set. Court questions defendant regarding status of counsel. Court questions the defendant regarding earnings and dependents. Court directs defendnat to pay $250.00 toward appointment of counsel. Then $50 per month commencing June 1, 2016 towards attorney fees. Court will appoint counsel to represent defendant upon payment of $250.00.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 09:55 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:12 PM: Defendant Michael J. Lambrecht in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today.  NGP received and entered.  Court orders $500 cash bond w/conditions.    PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.
